answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources you might find useful. 
Below is a sample City Manager Performance Evaluation Form.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/document/301268/city_manager_performance_evaluation
I have included sample Performance Measurement Policies and case studies from different areas. 
Saco, Maine
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302540/Performance_Measurement_Policy_City_of_Saco_Maine
St. Pete Beach, Florida
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/6568/St_Pete_Beach_and_Its_Performance_Measurement_System_PERFORM
Monmouth County, New Jersey
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/9006/Monmouth_Countys_Strategic_Plan
Westminster, Colorado
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1509/Measuring_What_Matters
Mesa, Arizona
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/302973/What_Works_Sample_Police_Case_Study
The articles below are from the Management Education Group describe best practices for employee evaluations.
http://icma.org/en/Article/11834/Painless_Performance_Evaluations_Training_You_Can_Do_Yourself
http://icma.org/en/Article/10303/Taking_the_Pain_Out_of_Performance_Evaluations
This article discusses performance measurement software that is used in Williamsburg, VA. 
http://icma.org/en/Article/100976/Efficient_Performance_Management_System 
The following articles look at how stronger Board/Manager Relations and organizational culture allow for better performance measurement practices. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/7291/Organizational_Culture__Its_Importance_in_Performance_Measurement
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2099/Building_Better_BoardManager_Relations
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/4315/Improve_Use_of_Performance_Measures_for_Department_and_Countywide_Decision_Making
This report looks at citizens as active participants in the performance measurement process.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1578/Citizens_as_Partners_in_Performance_Management 
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Stanton Bond
text:
I am interested in guidance on the development of department head evaluation and performance measurement practices which encourage goal setting, year over year improvements, responsiveness to the public, and advancement of strategic goals as determined by the Board of Trustees and the Village Manager. We are looking for a non-threatening process that brings good discipline to performance reviews while ensuring that the strategic goals of our Village and our obligation to customer responsiveness are being met.
An adjunct to the above is guidance on how to develop coherent and actionable strategic goals from a Board of Trustees which can be leveraged into evaluation practices for the Village Manager and at the Department Head level.
title: Department Head Evaluation and Performance Measurement
